Package org.microbean.type

Class Type<T>

java.lang.Object
org.microbean.type.Type<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the thing representing a Java type that is being adapted; often a Type or some other framework's representation of one
Direct Known Subclasses:
JavaType
@Experimental public abstract class Type<T> extends Object
A value-like object representing a (Java-like) type for purposes of testing assignability.

Concisely: Types represent java.lang.reflect.Types (or other frameworks' similar representations) without any dependence on java.lang.reflect.Type.

This class is used primarily by the Type.Semantics class and its subclasses.

Author:
Laird Nelson
See Also:
  • Type.Semantics

    A Type.VariantSemantics implementation that implements Java type assignability semantics, which are covariant.
    static class 
    Type.InvariantSemantics
    A Type.VariantSemantics implementation that does not permit subtyping, but that compares wildcard types covariantly.
    static class 
    Type.Semantics
    An abstract embodiment of Type assignability rules.
    static class 
    Type.VariantSemantics
    An abstract partial Type.Semantics that permits subtyping.

  • Method Details

    • named

      @OverridingEncouraged public boolean named()
      Returns true if and only if this Type represents a Java type that has a name.

      In the Java reflective type system, only Class and TypeVariable instances have names.

      Returns:
      true if and only if this Type represents a Java type that has a name
      See Also:
      • name()
      • Class.getName()
      • TypeVariable.getName()
      Idempotency:
      Implementations of this method must be idempotent and deterministic.
      Thread Safety:
      Implementations of this method must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • name

      public abstract String name()
      Returns the name of this Type if it has one or null if it does not.

      Only classes and type variables in the Java reflective type system have names.

      Returns:
      the name of this Type, or null
      Idempotency:
      Implementations of this method must be idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      Implementations of this method may, and often will, return null.
      Thread Safety:
      Implementations of this method must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • represents

      @OverridingEncouraged public boolean represents(Type<?> type)
      Returns true if this Type represents the same type as that represented by the supplied Type.

      Type representation is not the same thing as equality. Specifically, a Type may represent another Type exactly, but may not be equal to it.

      Equality is subordinate to type representation. That is, in determining whether a given Type represents another Type, their equals(Object) methods may be called, but a Type's equals(Object) method must not call represents(Type).

      Parameters:
      type - the Type to test; may be null in which case false will be returned
      Returns:
      true if this Type represents the same type as that represented by the supplied Type
      Idempotency:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, idempotent and deterministic.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • object

      public final T object()
      Returns the object supplied at construction time that is the type this Type is representing.
      Returns:
      the object supplied at construction time that is the type this Type is representing
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • top

      public abstract boolean top()
      Returns true if and only if this Type represents the uppermost reference type in the type system.

      In all practical cases, if an implementation of this method returns true, it means this Type represents Object.class.

      Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not meet these requirements.

      Returns:
      true if and only if this Type represents the uppermost reference type in the type system, e.g. Object.class
      Idempotency:
      Implementations of this method must be idempotent and deterministic.
      Thread Safety:
      Implementations of this method must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • box

      public abstract Type<T> box()
      If this Type represents a primitive type, and if and only if boxing is enabled in the type system being represented, returns a Type representing the corresponding "wrapper type", or this Type itself in all other cases.

      Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not meet these requirements.

      Returns:
      a Type representing the corresponding "wrapper type" where appropriate, or this
      Idempotency:
      Implementations of this method must be idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      Implementations of this method must not return null.
      Thread Safety:
      Implementations of this method must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • directSupertypes

      public abstract Collection<? extends Type<T>> directSupertypes()
      Returns an unmodifiable and immutable Collection of the direct supertypes of this Type, or an empty Collection if there are no direct supertypes.

      The direct supertypes of a type are defined to be those which are described by the Java Language Specification, section 4.10.2, minus any types featuring wildcards.

      These direct supertypes of a reflective Java type may be acquired if needed via the JavaTypes.directSupertypes(java.lang.reflect.Type) method.

      The Collection returned must not contain this and must have no null or duplicate elements.

      The ordering within the returned Collection is not specified, but must be deterministic between invocations.

      The size of the Collection returned must not change between calls.

      Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not meet these requirements.

      Returns:
      an unmodifiable and immutable Collection of the direct supertypes of this Type; never null
      Idempotency:
      Implementations of this method must be idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      Implementations of this method must not return null.
      Thread Safety:
      Implementations of this method must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • type

      public abstract Type<T> type()
      If this Type represents a parameterized type or a generic array type, returns a Type representing its raw type or generic component type, or, if this Type does not represent a parameterized type or a generic array type, returns this.

      Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not meet these requirements.

      Returns:
      a suitable Type; never null; often this
      Idempotency:
      Implementations of this method must be idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      Implementations of this method must not return null.
      Thread Safety:
      Implementations of this method must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • hasTypeParameters

      @OverridingEncouraged public boolean hasTypeParameters()
      Returns true if and only if this Type represents a generic class by virtue of having type parameters.

      This implementation calls the typeParameters() method and returns true if the resulting List is not empty. Subclasses are encouraged to provide a faster implementation.

      Returns:
      true if and only if this Type represents a generic class by virtue of having type parameters
      See Also:
      • typeParameters()

    • hasTypeArguments

      @OverridingEncouraged public boolean hasTypeArguments()

      This implementation calls the typeArguments() method and returns true if the resulting List is not empty. Subclasses are encouraged to provide a faster implementation.

      Returns:
      true if and only if this Type represents a parameterized type by virtue of having type arguments
      See Also:
      • typeArguments()

    • typeParameters

      public abstract List<? extends Type<T>> typeParameters()
      Returns an unmodifiable List of this Type's type parameters.

      The returned List will be non-empty if and only if this Type models a generic class.

      Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not meet these requirements.

      Returns:
      an unmodifiable List of this Type's type parameters; never null
      Idempotency:
      Implementations of this method must be idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      Implementations of this method must not return null.
      Thread Safety:
      Implementations of this method must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • componentType

      public abstract Type<T> componentType()
      Returns the component type of this Type, if there is one, or null if there is not.

      Implementations of this method must return a non-null result only when this Type represents a type that is either an array or a generic array type.

      Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not meet these requirements.

      Returns:
      the component type of this Type, if there is one, or null if there is not
      Idempotency:
      Implementations of this method must be idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      Implementations of this method may return null.
      Thread Safety:
      Implementations of this method must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • upperBounded

      @OverridingEncouraged public boolean upperBounded()
      Returns true if and only if this Type represents either a type variable or a wildcard type.

      This implementation calls the upperBounds() method and returns true if the resulting List is not empty. Subclasses are encouraged to provide a faster implementation.

      Undefined behavior will result if an override does not meet these requirements.

      Returns:
      true if and only if this Type represents either a type variable or a wildcard type
      See Also:
      • upperBounds()

      @OverridingEncouraged public boolean lowerBounded()
      Returns true if and only if this Type represents a wildcard type with a lower bound.

      This implementation calls the lowerBounds() method and returns true if the resulting List is not empty. Subclasses are encouraged to provide a faster implementation.

      Undefined behavior will result if an override does not meet these requirements.

      Returns:
      true if and only if this Type represents a wildcard type with lower bounds
      See Also:
      • lowerBounds()

      This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • lowerBounds

      public abstract List<? extends Type<T>> lowerBounds()
      Returns an unmodifiable List of this Type's lower bounds.

      The returned List will be non-empty if and only if this Type models a lower-bounded wildcard type.

      Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not meet these requirements.

      Returns:
      an unmodifiable List of this Type's lower bounds; never null; often empty
      Idempotency:
      Implementations of this method must be idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      Implementations of this method must not return null.
      Thread Safety:
      Implementations of this method must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • upperBounds

      public abstract List<? extends Type<T>> upperBounds()
      Returns an unmodifiable List of this Type's upper bounds.

      The returned List will be non-empty if and only if this Type models either a type variable, an unbounded wildcard type, or an upper-bounded wildcard type.

      Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not meet these requirements.

      Returns:
      an unmodifiable List of this Type's upper bounds; never null; often empty
      Idempotency:
      Implementations of this method must be idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      Implementations of this method must not return null.
      Thread Safety:
      Implementations of this method must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • isClass

      public final boolean isClass()
      Returns true if and only if this Type models a class.

      This method returns true if and only if named() returns true and upperBounded() returns false.

      Returns:
      true if and only if this Type models a class
      See Also:
      • named()
      • upperBounded()
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • genericArrayType

      public final boolean genericArrayType()
      Returns true if and only if this Type models a generic array type.

      This method returns true if and only if componentType() returns a non-value and type() returns a Type that is not this.

      Returns:
      true if and only if this Type models a generic array type
      See Also:
      • componentType()
      • type()
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • parameterizedType

      public final boolean parameterizedType()

      This method returns true if and only if hasTypeArguments() returns true.

    • wildcard

      public final boolean wildcard()
      Returns true if and only if this Type models a wildcard type.

      This method returns true if and only if named() returns true and one of upperBounded() or lowerBounded() returns true.

      Returns:
      true if and only if this Type models a wildcard type
      See Also:
      • named()
      • upperBounded()
      • lowerBounded()
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • supertypes

      public final Collection<? extends Type<T>> supertypes()
      Returns all the supertypes of this Type (which includes this Type).

      This method reflexively and transitively applies the direct supertype relation (represented by the directSupertypes() method) to this Type and returns an unmodifiable Collection containing the result.

      Returns:
      an unmodifiable Collection containing all the supertypes of this Type (which includes this Type); never null
      See Also:
      • directSupertypes()
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • supertype

      public final <X> boolean supertype(Type<X> sub)
      Returns true if and only if this Type is a supertype of the supplied Type.

      This method uses a combination of the supertypes() method and the represents(Type) method in its implementation.

      Type Parameters:
      X - the type represented by the supplied Type
      Parameters:
      sub - the purported subtype; must not be null
      Returns:
      true if and only if this Type is a supertype of the supplied Type
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if sub is null
      See Also:
      • supertypes()
      • represents(Type)
